channel.title: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi
channel.description:
Hi. I have a PI Base.
Where do I make ::PURE And ::MASTER,Like I wanna make it so everyone can use it.
Matt

K I’ll try this when i’m comp.

item.title: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:6, topic:372308”]Or, simply take out the ‘&& c.playerRights >= 0’ part.
Making it look like

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master")) { if (c.inWild()) return; for(int i = 0; i < c.playerLevel.length; i++) { c.playerXP = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } } [/quote]
I think it would be easier for him to just change the 3 to 0

Read full topic
item.source: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi

item.title: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Or, simply take out the ‘&& c.playerRights >= 0’ part.
Making it look like

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master")) {
      if (c.inWild())
         return;
      for(int i = 0; i < c.playerLevel.length; i++) {
         c.playerXP = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
         c.playerLevel = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP);
         c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
      }
   }

Read full topic
item.source: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi

item.title: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

Change the 3 to 0, when its set to 0 all players can use that command.

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master") && c.playerRights >= [b]0[/b]) { if (c.inWild()) return; for(int i = 0; i < c.playerLevel.length; i++) { c.playerXP = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } }

Read full topic
item.source: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi

Seriously… All you have to do is copy them, then paste them into your Commands.java.

item.title: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi
item.dc:creator: @rang3_pkz rang3 pkz
item.description:
@rang3_pkz wrote:

So I put both of those in Command.Java? I looked in Command.Java but it says nothing about Player Rights for ::master.

Any help with that?

Matt

Read full topic
item.source: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi

item.title: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi
item.dc:creator: @EMINEM_BEAST EMINEM BEAST™
item.description:
@EMINEM_BEAST wrote:

Go to your source files and search: Commands open up the file,
Add this for the pure command:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("pure") && c.playerRights >= 3) { c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 0); c.getPA().addSkillXP(0, 1); c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 2); c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 3); c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 4); c.getPA().addSkillXP(136594, 5); c.getPA().addSkillXP(14000000, 6); }

And here is the master command:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("master") && c.playerRights >= 3) { if (c.inWild()) return; for(int i = 0; i < c.playerLevel.length; i++) { c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5; c.playerLevel[i] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[i]); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } }

Read full topic
item.source: How to add ::pure and ::master for everyone in pi
